p: Samples of brain, heart, lung, spleen, liver, and kidney tissues, positive by RT-PCR, and confirmed by Sanger sequencing, were analyzed by histopathology and immunohistochemistry. The samples were processed by the conventional histological method, which consists of dehydration in scaling concentration alcohols and their inclusion in paraffin. Sections with 4 Î¼m thickness were stained with hematoxylin/eosin and processed for optical microscopy studies.
